revised_title: Experiments on Pendulum Motion in Vacuo and the Effects of Air Pressure
tldr: The author conducts experiments on pendulum motion in a vacuum and under varying air pressure, discovering that pendulums vibrate larger in a vacuum and that air pressure affects the speed of pendulums. The results suggest that the rarity of the medium in a vacuum and the effects of air pressure on pendulums should be considered when studying their motion.
